intro: Besleria subdecurrens, commonly known as the narrow-leafed besleria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant features elliptical to lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers, which typically bloom in shades of pink or red, are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant in greenhouses and tropical gardens due to its ornamental value.
